ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:0.5_0: 42. The second training rule on without bringing
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six put their whole hand in their mouths while eating. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not put my whole hand in my mouth while eating,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.4_0: he should not put the whole hand in his mouth while eating;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, puts his whole hand in his mouth while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.7.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk42:1.9_0: The second rule, the second training rule on fire, is finished.
